document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of digenean parasites of birds from Argentina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of digenean parasites of birds from Argentina

bibRefCitation.author: Szidat
bibRefCitation.refString: Szidat, L. & Nani, A. (1951) Diplostomiasis cerebralis del Pejerrey. Una grave epizootia que afecta a la economia nacional producida por larvas de Trematodes que destruyen el cerebro de los pejerreyes. Revista Nacional del Instituto de Investigacion de las Ciencias Naturales anexo al Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales " Bernardino Rivadavia ", 1, 323 - 394.

bibRefCitation.author: Szidat
bibRefCitation.refString: Szidat, L. & Nani, A. (1951) Diplostomiasis cerebralis del Pejerrey. Una grave epizootia que afecta a la economia nacional producida por larvas de Trematodes que destruyen el cerebro de los pejerreyes. Revista Nacional del Instituto de Investigacion de las Ciencias Naturales anexo al Museo Argentino de Ciencias Naturales " Bernardino Rivadavia ", 1, 323 - 394.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syn.:
Diplostomum
(A.)
mordax (Szidat & Nani) Ostrowski
de Núñez, 1982 .
Diplostomum
(A.) compactum (Lutz, 1928 ) Dubois, 1970 .

Natural host:
Phalacrocorax brasilianus (Gmelin)
.

Experimental hosts:
Gallus gallus domesticus
(L.),
Pitangus sulphuratus bolivianus (Lafresnaye)
.
Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: Buenos Aires Province.

Life history: Hi 1 :
Biomphalaria peregrina (d’Orbigny)
(experimental and natural host from Limay River, Neuquén Province),
B. straminea (Dunker)
(experimental host). Hi 2 :
Odontesthes hatcheri (Eigenmann)
,
O . bonariensis
(Valenciennes)
,
O . smitti
, (Lahille)
,
Percichthys trucha (Valenciennes)
,
Aplochiton taeniatus Jenyns
,
Galaxias maculatus (Jenyns)
, G. p lat e i Steindachner,
Onchorhynchus mykiss (Walbaum)
,
Jenynsia lineata (Jenyns)
(natural hosts from Buenos Aires, Córdoba, La Rioja, Jujuy, Tucumán, Río Negro, Neuquén and Chubut Provinces);
Cnesterodon decemmaculatus (Jennyns)
,
Phalloceros caudimaculatus (Hensel)
(experimental hosts); metacercariae in brain.

References:
Szidat & Nani ( 1951
, 1952 ),
Szidat ( 1956
, 1964 ,
1969
), Fuster de
Plaza & Boschi ( 1957 )
, Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1964, 1968 a, 1970, 1977 , 1982, 1992 a),
Ortubay et al . ( 1989
, 1994 ),
Viozzi & Flores ( 2002 )
.

Diplostomum
v. Nordmann, 1832

bibRefCitation.author: Szidat
bibRefCitation.refString: Szidat, L. (1964) Vergleichende Helminthologische untersuchungen an den argentinischen grossmowen Larus marinus dominicanus Lichtenstein und Larus ridibundus maculipennis Lichtenstein nebst neuen beobachtungen uber die artbildung bei parasiten. Zeitschrift fur Parasitenkunde, 24, 351 - 414.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hosts:
Larus dominicanus Lichtenstein
,
L. maculipennis Lichtenstein . Site
of infection: intestine.

Localities: Huechulaufquen Lake, Neuquén Province and Rosario Lake, Chubut Province Life history: Hi 1 : unknown. Hi 2 :
Gymnotus
sp. (natural host) from Chaco Province; metacercariae in
brain and medulla.

References:
Szidat ( 1964 )
,
Niewiadomska et al. ( 1989 )
,
Kreiter & Semenas ( 1997 )
.
Dolichorchis Dubois, 1961

Dolichorchis bonariensis Ostrowski
de Núñez, 1970 Syn.:
Diplostomum ( Dolichorchis ) bonariensis Ostrowski
de Núñez, 1970 Host:
Phalacrocorax brasilianus (Gmelin)
. Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: Buenos Aires city.

Life history: Hi 1 : unknown. Hi 2 : probably
Curimatorbis platanus (Günther)
from Obras Sanitarias, Bue­
nos Aires city; metacercariae in the brain. Material deposited: MACN .

Dolichorchis lacombeensis Lunaschi & Drago, 2006 Host:
Ardea cocoi Linnaeus.
Site of infection: intestine
Locality: Lacombe lagoon, Buenos Aires Province. Material deposited: MLP , 5292 .

Reference:
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2006 a)
.

Host:
Phalacrocorax brasilianus (Gmelin)
.
Site of infection: intestine.
Localities: Río de la Plata, Buenos Aires Province, Obras Sanitarias, Buenos Aires city; Embalse, Cór­
doba Province and Río de la Plata.

References:
Szidat & Nani ( 1951 )
, Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1970, 1992 a).

Hosts:
Caracara plancus (Miller)
,
Phalacrocorax brasilianus (Gmelin)
. Site of infection: small intestine.
Locality: Clorinda, Formosa Province.

Material deposited: MLP , 5330, 5331 ; CNHE 5312 . Reference:
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2005 )
.

Natural hosts:
Butorides striata (Linnaeus)
,
Ixobrychus involucris (Vieillot)
,
Ardea alba Linnaeus, A.

alba egretta Gmelin
,
Plegadis chihi (Vieillot)
.

Experimental Hosts:
Gallus gallus domesticus
(L.),
Anas platyrhynchos L. Site
of infection: small intestine.
Localities: La Plata Zoological Garden, La Plata and Punta Blanca, Buenos Aires Province; Obras Sani­
tarias, Buenos Aires city.

Life history: Hi 1 :
Gundlachia concentrica (d'Orbigny)
(experimental host). Hi 2 :
Jenynsia lineata (Jenyns)
,
Phalloceros caudimaculatus (Hensel)
,
Cnesterodon decemmaculatus (Jenyns)
(experimental and natural hosts from Río de La Plata); neascus­type metacercariae encyst in body cavity and kidney.
Material deposited: MLP .

References:
Boero et al. ( 1972 b)
, Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1973, 1992 a), Doma & Ostrowski de Núñez

Posthodiplostomum mignum
Boero, Led & Brandetti, 1972
b Host:
Ardea cocoi Linnaeus.
Locality: La Plata Zoological Garden, La Plata, Buenos Aires Province. Site of infection: small intestine.

Reference:
Boero et al. ( 1972 b)
.

Syns.:
Neodiplostomum
sp. Ostrowski de Núñez, 1970

Neodiplostomum ( N. ) pseudoconicum
(Ostrowski de Núñez)
Nasir & Díaz, 1972
Host:
Phalacrocorax brasilianus (Gmelin)
.
Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: Quequén, Buenos Aires Province.

References: Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1970 ),
Nasir & Díaz ( 1972 )
,
Dubois ( 1977 )
.
Sphincterodiplostomum Dubois, 1936

Sphincterodiplostomum musculosum Dubois, 1936 Host:
Ardea alba Linnaeus.
Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: Clorinda, Formosa Province.

Life history: Hi 1 : unknown. Hi 2 :
Hoplias malabaricus (Bloch)
(natural host) from Chaco Province; meta­
cercariae in the eye’s orbit.
Material deposited: MLP , 5404 .

References:
Szidat ( 1969 )
,
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2006 b)
.

bibRefCitation.author: Lunaschi
bibRefCitation.refString: Lunaschi, L. I. & Drago, F. B. (2004) Descripcion de una especie nueva de Tylodelphys (Digenea: Diplostomidae) parasita de Podiceps major (Aves: Podicepedidae) de Argentina. Anales del Instituto de Biologia, UNAM, Serie Zoologia, 75, 245 - 252.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host:
Podiceps major (Boddaert)
. Site of infection: intestine.

Locality: Lacombe lagoon, Buenos Aires Province. Material deposited: MLP , holotype 5309 , paratypes 5310, 5311 . Reference:
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2004 )
.

Apatemon gracilis (Rudolphi, 1819 ) Szidat, 1928 Host
:
Cygnus melanocorypha (Molina)
.
Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: not reported.

Reference:
Boero et al. ( 1972 a)
.

Host:
Cygnus melanocorypha (Molina)
.
Site of infection: small intestine.

Locality: La Plata Zoological Garden, La Plata, Buenos Aires Province. References:
Boero & Led ( 1968 )
, Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1992 a). Comments: Ostrowski de Núñez ( 1992 a) erroneously reported that
Boero & Led ( 1968 )
found this spe­

cies in
Coscoroba coscoroba (Molina)
.
Host: Egretta thula (Molina).
Site of infection: intestine.

Locality: Buenos Aires Zoological Garden, Buenos Aires city. Life history: Hi 1 :
Biomphalaria straminea (Dunker)
(experimental host). Hi 2 :
Cnesterodon decemmaculatus (Jenyns)
,
Cichlasoma facetum (Jennyns)
(experimental hosts); metacercariae in body cavity.

References: Ostrowski de
Núñez ( 1989
, 1992a).

Cardiocephaloides brandesii (Szidat, 1928 ) Sudarikov, 1959 Host
:
Larus maculipennis Lichtenstein .
Site of infection: intestine.

Locality: Huechulaufquen Lake, Lanín National Park, Neuquén Province. Reference:
Szidat ( 1964 )
.

Cardiocephaloides physalis (Lutz, 1927 ) Dubois, 1937 Host
:
Spheniscus magellanicus (Forster)
.
Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: not reported.

Reference:
Boero et al. ( 1972 a)

Comments:
Timi et al. ( 1999 )
hypothesized that the metacercariae found in eyes of
Engraulis anchoita Hubbs & Marini
from Argentine and Uruguayan Seas and described as
Cardiocephaloides
sp. ( MLP , 4555 ), probably belong to the species
C. physalis .

Cardiocephaloides
sp.

Host:
Spheniscus magellanicus (Forster)
.
Site of infection: intestine.

Locality: Península Valdés, Chubut Province. Reference:
Pazos et al. ( 2003 )
.

Hosts:
Milvago chimango (Vieillot)
,
Buteo magnirostris (Gmelin)
. Site of infection: intestine.
Localities: Urribelarrea, Buenos Aires Province; La Marcela farm, Pirané, Formosa Province. Material deposited: MLP , 5508 .

References:
Boero & Led ( 1971 )
,
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2006 c)
.

Syn.
Apharyngostrigea brasiliana (Szidat, 1928 ) Szidat, 1929 Hosts
:
Ardea alba Linnaeus
,
Bubulcus ibis (Linnaeus)
. Site of infection: intestine.

Localities: La Plata Zoological Garden, La Plata; De Monte lagoon, Buenos Aires Province. References:
Boero et al. ( 1972 b)
,
Labriola & Suriano ( 1998 )
.

Strigea falconis brasiliana Szidat, 1929 Host
:
Buteo magnirostris (Gmelin)
. Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: La Marcela farm, Pirané, Formosa Province. Material deposited: MLP , 5506 .

Reference:
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2006 c)
.

Host:
Buteo magnirostris (Gmelin)
. Site of infection: intestine.
Locality: La Marcela farm, Pirané, Formosa Province. Material deposited: MLP , 5507 .

Reference:
Lunaschi & Drago ( 2006 c)
.
